website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS20's 20x zoom lens might be the main attraction, but the camera is all-around excellent.
pros: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS20 has an excellent design and feature set, including an ultrawide-angle 20x zoom lens, GPS, and semimanual and manual shooting modes, as well as fast shooting performance and improved low-light photo quality from previous versions
cons: Using all of the ZS20's high-performance features, such as its near-pointless touch screen, can really cut into battery life
Also, photos are noisy and soft when viewed at 100 percent

website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS20 squeezes a 20x zoom lens into its compact body. It isn't the fastest camera, and the lens lags behind the competition in sharpness, but it does well at higher ISOs and has a built-in GPS.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...but one flaw that may be deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played around with this camera too much, however in the IA mode and taking photos indoors with moderate lighting have produced photos with the bottom left hand corner "shadow". No additional zoom. the built in flash isn't reaching the far left bottom corner. it's ruining all my indoor pictures that require flash. I'm not sure if this is a design flaw or just my camera. Now, i'm not sure i want to keep this camera as i do take a lot indoor photos. If anyone has a solution, please share! Outdoor photos turn out great! No shutter lag. Crisp photos. camera itself isn't too big nor too small. feels great in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: SDsportsFan

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Incredible zoom! You can easily zoom onto things several stories up and have a crisp picture making it seem like it is right in front of you. I've taken pictures of things I could only see in detail once I took the picture/ This is by far the best feature of the camera! Decent battery life- it'll get you through a full day of tourist photographing, etc, but when on a trip you will need to recharge each night if you're using it a lot. Filming is also good, though the audio isn't great and non techies seem confused about how to activate filming mode. Cons- Can be somewhat grainy.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: The overall image quality is good but not DSLR quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is jam packed with features. The overall image quality is good but not DSLR quality, which is to be expected. I have been using it to shoot interiors of homes with a tripod, no flash, and the camera's HDR feature with great success. Images come out well balanced with accurate colors and adequate sharpness. My only complaint is that the camera can be a bit slow at times. Sometimes it takes a few seconds to process an image before you can take another shot. While not that big of a deal, it can get annoying. I've even tried a faster class 10 SD card but it is the camera that is causing the bottle neck.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Santoro

customer_reviews.title: So far this little camera is great. I initially purchased this b/c I wanted a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this little camera is great. I initially purchased this b/c I wanted a camera that can take decent pictures in low-light conditions. This camera has a setting for low light without a tripod. At a recent high school orchestra concert, I took pictures without and with the low light w/o tripod setting and the difference was very significant. The pictures were so much clearer than without the low light setting. I've also taken quite a few pictures outside and some close up pictures and it does a great job. So far this is a great camera. I did purchase an additional battery for backup, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Die too soon
customer_reviews.text: A camera like that can not break alraedy after 3 years. The camera is not working anymore and shows a problem with the zoom, but never fall down. Too expensive to repair. This is the second camera from Panasonic I bought in 5 years and both are broken. My next camera will by again a Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan W.

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully Good Camera With Lots of Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace my 2 year old Lumix ZS-15 which, after 2 years and about 2,000 photos, developed contamination on the light sensor and internal lens. I am not a careless user, having been an avid hobbyist for more than 30 years so I suspect a flaw in the design. This makes me suspicious of the ZS-20 but I gambled because the Leica lens makes very sharp images. I am disappointed at Panasonic's total lack of response to my queries about suggestions on how to avoid this contamination. I have now made about 200 pictures with the ZS020 and it has performed well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Batey

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera! Bought it July 2014 and have used it almost a year now. All I wanted was a good basic camera to take nice photos--and this is it! Got it for a trip to Great Britain and have received lots of compliments on the great photos it took. I'm sure this camera can do a lot more than I use it for, but I am very happy with the pics I get. The zoom is especially nice too. It's a perfect size and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: annie bananie

customer_reviews.title: Lumix ZS20, great camera great price
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes phenomenal pix in fairly low light conditions. I like it MUCH better than the ZS30 I had for about a month. this model has a switch for on/off vs. soft button, next to the shutter. my mother, mother-in-law, and sister-in-law all have the same camera I was so impressed with it. simple to use, I recommend getting a second battery as a backup, not because it drains quickly but just in case. HD video is pretty good too. GPS is a cool feature. if you can test out this camera do so, I think you'll like it and the price is very good.
customer_reviews.author: shiv

customer_reviews.title: pictures are over-exposed and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Read the other reviews and internet forums. This camera has a bad history of problems. My issue was pictures were intermittently getting over-exposed. When it worked, it was a great camera, but it failed too often. I returned the camera for repair and had similar repair experience to many of the others who have posted negative reviews here. Poor customer service. In fact, after having the camera for a month, Panasonic sent me back a Lady's Electric Shaver rather than my repaired camera. This camera has lots of great features and abilities for a small camera. Unfortunately they just don't work often enough.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best small camera I have ever owned. I tried three other high rated cameras before finding this one. The camera takes fast pictures, great focus and some good advanced features for anyone wanting to be more creative. Software is easy to use and straightforward. Really like that you charge the battery while it's in the camera and not a separate charger. Similar to a cell phone. Great camera.
customer_reviews.author: AW515

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Focuses fast, pictures are sharp, easy to use. I really like that there is a separate button to record video, so you don't have to switch modes if you want to take a video between pictures or a picture between different videos - just push a different button. The GPS receiver takes a long time to lock on - I've just stopped using it all together. But other than that, this has been a great camera. It has much better low-light exposures than my previous camera, a good HDR mode, and the color balance is much more accurate than my previous camera.
customer_reviews.author: dallin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera with a fantastic zoom
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with the performance of my Lumix ZS 20 Camera.Overall a great capable camera at this price range. Pros: 1. Excellent zoom 2. Very sharp & crisp audio & video quality 3. GPS is a good feature for travelers like me 4. Made in Japan Quality 5. Cool panoramic shots Cons. 1. Average photo quality in low lighting condition. 2. The on-off button could have scope for improvement , sometime accidentally it gets switched on. 3. Non standard mini USB cable is a big NO... 4. Touch screen sometimes lets you down 5. Takes a while to charge the in-camera battery, not very happy about the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but died in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pictures, good color, great zoom, excellent video. Quite a nice camera. Why 3 stars? I used it light to moderately, and never abused it..... But here we are 2 years later... We took a great trip to New Zealand, a couple of weeks ago I had to "recycle" the powering on process a few timed (camera gave message to turn off and on) .... Missed a few pics that were easily caught before. This week the cycle message is now "system error". For 3 days now, it's totally dead..... All I get is" system error ". Great camera while it lasted, 2 years is not enough, will replace when I get home next week, won't be a Panasonic,
customer_reviews.author: Bob White

customer_reviews.title: The camera comes with a DVD on which is the ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera comes with a DVD on which is the advanced owner's manual and software for downloading and processing the pictures. My computer has no DVD drive, so I can't download these files. I went online for help, but the company is unwilling to deal with this. These items should be available to download from the Panasonic site. At these prices, that's the least a buyer should expect. I'm considering returning the camera.
customer_reviews.author: 3boysjnw

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a replacement for a Panasonic DMCTZ4, I would have purchased the DMCTZ4 again but couldn't find one. I dropped my old camera and the zoom no longer worked. I kept getting an error message (turn camera off...) but alas it was ruined. Now to this camera. It was very easy to use. Having said that there are many features that I haven't used because I haven't read all the directions (I tend to use something until I run into a glitch or need further information). Once I read all the directions I know I will love it as much as I did my previous Panasonic. It's small and lightweight - perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: The Panasonic Lumix is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a photography expert but needed a small camera for those special times. I no longer need a fone except for the one that came with my car.That one had a small,inferior quality camera. The Panasonic Lumix is perfect for my needs. I have used this in foul weather with no damage. Great pictures and enough settings to take a quality shot every time. I love the camera but if you write asking technical questions about it for me to answer, you would be better served downloading the manual on it from the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: like other users
customer_reviews.text: Warning, like other users, I have experienced problems with the lens. It fails to open after two years of use. Warranty ended and cost me $189 and up for repairs (estimated). Camera tech said that the lens motor failed and it is a common problem with this camera. When it worked it worked well. Be careful of dust and dirt as it will bind up your lens or get inside the lens where all of your photos will show marks. You would be fortunate to have it last longer than two years.
customer_reviews.author: dymoto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little black camera
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera ! Small. Easy to carry in purse. Excellent pics. Easy to use. My second Panasonic camera which my photographer brother in law recommended for me for my needs. I take sporting pics as well as record life events from friends getting together to family milestones and birthdays. Scenery always on my travels. Needed a wide angle, zoom, quick shutter speed, red eye teduction setting. Video capability and intelligent setting are great. Can edit and enhance pics easily. I've had many cameras over the years. As far as digital amateur one this is an excellent choice and great value. Amazon has best prices and quick delivery !
customer_reviews.author: StellaOnPoint

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, has lots of capabilities that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, has lots of capabilities that I have not had time and patience to explore. Small and handy. I was very happy with this camera (and still am), but on a recent trip when I happened to take some pictures with my Samsung Galaxy tablet, and when compared, I noticed the tablet's pictures are of better quality. Perhaps if one sets this camera well, it takes better pictures, but for somebody like me to just point and shoot on occasion, the tablet has been taking better pictures; so I give this camera 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Picky customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: After burning through a series of Canon point-and-shoots, and being really impressed with the Panasonic Lumix FZ200, I bough this camera. It's easy to use and images are clear and bright. I've not had any problems with it - it's held up in really cold weather as well as light rain. I love the dedicated video button which makes shooting video so easy as you don't have to scroll through menus or switch modes. Overall, this camera is great quality and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: GogTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My ZS20 is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: First pass test of stills & video, including zooming to 20X meets my expectation...and then some. After doing a serious review of camera data for several models, I rated this Panasonic unit second to the Canon S100, but the S100 has only a 5X zoom....I needed more. After a data review determined the top 3, I did a hands on feel, operationonal fuction, and sample photo tests. The ZS20 won based on a more solid feel, and faster focus. The other two had a light weight plastic feel. Ease of operation and picture quality were all close to equal.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: With a great zoom, nice picture stabilizer and lots of special functions...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera (for less than $200) to get a better pictures result at low light, big distances (i.e. a good optical Zoom is a plus for me) and fast response, required if you have kids. I am still understanding the functions reading the user guide, but the basic (plug-and-play) is working fine. I am using a SanDisk 16G Ultra micro SDHC with adapter to SD size. Video quality is good. Battery life, so far acceptable, but a spare battery and charger is a plus, since my unit did not came with a charger in the retail box. FullHD videos is just: "Wow". I am still testing the camera, so I will update this review soon.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for almost great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I loved my last lumix but wanted more manual control (while still having small size and click and shoot). It does all that. I am not pleased however to discover that it evidently requires Lumix batteries because of a software change. My previous camera I had one Lumix and two generic batteries. This new one requires frequent charging and the high $ of Panasonic batteries make back ups less resonable. Plus it requires that you charge from the camera instead of an external charger (again hindering having a ready back up).
customer_reviews.author: Tool Happy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for a year now and it takes nice photos and the shutter speed is pretty quick. It has more settings than I know what to do with but what I like best is the scene mode which helps set the camera up for taking night photos, sports scenes and even portraits. My favorite part about this camera over the FUJI digital SLR wanta be I was using is that this very light weight and takes good pictures even from good distance away and it will mark the location of the photo based on GPS. It more than meets my recreational needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smile
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used. Seems to be working fine for the price. Packaged nicely. Came with “no” operating instructions though. There's always you tube!
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Good camera I'm sure.  But in my opinion, doesn't get the light right for flash.
customer_reviews.text: Must use and adjust Aperture mode or Program mode, auto doesn't get flash right. All other feature are way over-kill for what I need a camera for. Maybe a bit tooo professional for typical use.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Performance from Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time fan of Lumix cameras because they provide Leica lenses with wide zooms at competitive prices versus Leica cameras. This little camera packs a lot of sophisticated features and takes great shots. It is ideal for casual pocket carry. The 20X zoom with image stabilization gives you the ability to capture subjects at great distance with good quality. Only complaint is that small cameras have small buttons and these become more difficult to operate as I get older. I will probably use this camera in automatic mode most of the time and use a DSLR when I want to be "creative".
customer_reviews.author: E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wow....great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Panasonic I have had over the years, and this one is fantastic. I have tried it out in some very difficult light and contrast situations and it hasn't failed me yet. It has some fine optics, and the built in bracketing option is a real plus. I have had very clear and noiseless images even at the longer end of the zoom. Looking forward to traveling with this this summer. I can't stand carrying a tripod and a lot of gear around. This enables me to travel light without loosing quality. Great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Schoodic Lady

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This Camera is great, is really smart, the Ai function that select an scene automatically, works great!!!, the image quality is really good and the noise it is not a probleam untill ISO 800 or 1600 on small prints. The 20x zoom in this such compact body is fantastic. The only thing 2 things that to improve is the playback function (I personally prefer a button and not a switch that you need to change every time you want to see a picture or take one) The other thing is the body and buttons feels not strong as my previous Canon Isus 770is.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Del Bono

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Our second Camera in Lumix ZS series. First one was ZS3, which was also great but while taking pictures at the beach the sand messed up its zooming operation and camera would not work properly (occasionally complains about zoom error). Since we liked previous Lumix, we bought this one and we were not disappointed. Since we bought it fairly recently, we haven't used it much. So, haven't explored features like GPS etc. We used it for our trip to Yellowstone/GTNP and camera took amazing pictures of Tetons, wildlife, geysers etc. GPS seems to show us name of the place (eg. name of hiking trail) while taking pictures. 20X zoom is pretty powerful. Quite powerful camera in point-and-shoot category.
customer_reviews.author: Ashutosh K. Bahadure

customer_reviews.title: defected product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the camera 3.5 years ago. Two years later, all pictures started to have over-exposure. Tried different settings and reset camera to factory specs, but nothing helped. Contacted Panasonic and was told that since the camera's warranty already expired, I need to pay $200+ to have it repaired. Checked online and it seems that the problem is common. Yes, the camera is cheap but I expect it to last more than 2 years. Will stay away from Panasonic product from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Last year's model takes excellent pictures
customer_reviews.text: Very good pictures and a great user interface. Panasonic continues to make the auto focus and auto program (shutter and aperture) better with each generation of camera. Want to set your own shutter speed and lens opening? Easy, just select another mode. The ease of a point-and-shoot with the power to experiment. Even the menu system makes sense (unlike cameras from some other manufacturers). Small, fits in your pocket, takes very good pictures even in low light. The zoom is amazing too.
customer_reviews.author: G. McGowan

customer_reviews.title: True pocket camera with 20x zoom
customer_reviews.text: Two big advantages of this camera. First is that it's tiny, will really fit into a shirt pocket, and light. Second is the 20x zoom. Put those together and you have a very attractive package. Also to be noted is the GPS, which I find useful. It's a fairly easy camera to use, and the picture quality and performance are certainly comparable to other cameras in the same price range. Recommended, especially since the price has dropped to well under $200.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Not like new/ used quality
customer_reviews.text: Camera came dirty, battery and charger replaced with sub quality replacements. Camera stays charged for a day and I’m unable to use charging cables as it will not make a solid connection. Covers over lens don’t always close all the way... not happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Handy size, easy to switch to video
customer_reviews.text: I lost a previous version of this camera while on vacation, so I replaced it with this model. It's a bit thicker than the previous model making it a little harder to get into a pants pocket, and it requires a little bit bigger case. But the photo quality is great and taking videos is much easier thanks to the record button on the top (no need to switch modes anymore). This one has a real "on/off" switch, which was the reason I chose it. (I hear newer models have replaced with a button that can be accidentally triggered too easily).
customer_reviews.author: L. Sztajer

customer_reviews.title: The best P&S I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe the photos that I get with this camera. I am by no means a photographer, so my opinion is that of the average P&S user. With that in mind, I think this camera is wonderful. It's small but not so tiny that I feel like I can't grip it. I love the handhold on the front and the wrist strap. It's quick, it's got a wide angle, it takes great action shots (in good light), and the zoom is fantastic. For me, this camera is the perfect travel companion and all-rounder. (I highly recommend the MegaGear case for it, too.)
customer_reviews.author: Lilah W.

customer_reviews.title: OK picture quality, but is it designed to fall apart after 1 year?
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've bought. The picture quality is exactly what I need, but the camera is very poorly made. Both times I've bought this, the retractable lens cover broke after exactly 1 year. It will stop closing or alternatively not open fully blocking your shot. Next to go is the screen (with verticle lines developing and disrupting the display). Can still take pictures well, but ridiculous how poor the workmanship is.
customer_reviews.author: David Levitch

customer_reviews.title: Automated Lens Cover Started To Stick After 20 Days
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. It is awesome. But yesterday, just 20 days into using it, a Christmas present, the lens cover stopped fully retracting -- it would stick halfway, leaving just a slit exposed for the lens. Multiple recycling of the power fixed it the first time around, but it happened again the next time it was powered up. Think this is an anomaly in just this camera and that it is not a design or manufacturing fault. I own multiple Panasonics. Returned it today for a replacement. As ever doing so with Amazon was slick and painless. UPS just picked up the return. Just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: NH Author

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 SLRs, 2 DSLRs, and a bunch of compact cameras both digital and film. This camera has fantastic picture quality. I have a 2014 dslr, but sometimes can't tell the difference. They say a camera is all about the lens, and this has a carl zeiss. Also, this camera has auto focus when taking VIDEOs, which my dslr does not. Highly recommended. I turn off GPS to save battery life. Battery life is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Good but complex
customer_reviews.text: It is too complicated. I had to call the camera store to format a new memory card. It was buried deep in a sub, sub folder. The other features take some getting used to, like touching the screen and getting a lot of ground shots. The zoom knob is too touchy but the touch screen zoom is good once you get used to it. Like all cameras without a viewfinder, the display is useless in sunlight. You have to guess, shoot, shoot again. I like the way it feels and the controls. I'm sure that I'll like it more as I learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: nolato1

customer_reviews.title: Many things to like about this little camera
customer_reviews.text: Many things to like about this little camera, but my very favorite is the "through window" setting that allows me to shoot visitors to the bird feeders from my computer desk. Yesterday I caught the daddy flicker feeding his fledgling son (who is only a tiny bit smaller now than his father). I live on the shoulder of Mt. Hood and get a wide variety; actually, baby is sitting there asking for a bite right now.
customer_reviews.author: Martinbrattin

customer_reviews.title: Fourth Lumix I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I use it for real estate appraisals. The 20x optical zoom allows me to be a long distance from a house and still get a good picture so everyone can see what it looks like up close. Decent time lapse between taking pictures. Lots of other goodies that I don't use that much but when I've tried them seem to work very well. If you need a good point and shoot digital I would highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: AEP

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, and loads of features and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Had an earlier version of the Lumix. It is still going strong. The impressive OPTICAL zoom is what sets these cameras apart from other compact digital cameras. I even take photos that are published in magazines with this camera. From a practical standpoint it has all of the features (that I use) of my gigantic DSLR but will fit inside a pocket of my motorcycle jacket. The lithium ion battery pack has capacity to take you through a long day of shooting with or without the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Harleycpl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features and quality
customer_reviews.text: Zs20 from amazon was a great deal. Chose this over the zs25...overall a great camera for the price. Videos are also very good. The 20x optical zoom with image stabilizer is really great! Now, why 4 stars...I would give 4.5 stars but I can't! My only minor complaint is 1. I wish there were more photo choices for image quality, 2. I expected even sharper images with the Leica lens, 3. Wish it had wifi connectivity to upload to social media!
customer_reviews.author: Peace2U

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice for Travelers
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 months with this camera since I bought it for Amazon, and I can give you guarantee that it is excellent quality and functionality. previously had a Kodak M1033 and i have no doubt in the sharpness of image,n voice quality during recording and of course duration of the battery that offers my new camera Panasonic. In addition to its extra features such as GPS and the location of the picture at the time of its capture pictures in 3D scenes which didn't try because I do not have the means to reproduce them
customer_reviews.author: Clovis Rondon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THE LUMIX
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I think Panasonic are the best cameras out there. The quality of the pictures are outstanding! Movies are perfect and the stereo sound is the best. I put it on my wish list and when the price dropped I bought it. This is a very small camera and I recommend you use the wrist strap when using it. The zoom is phenomenal for a small camera. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: tdjr50

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned and I owed a DSLR Rebel Canon before!
customer_reviews.text: This is one amazing camera. I compared the Sony HX30v and this camera was $100 less missing only the WIFI feature. No big deal and it is just one great camera. One thing is good to know. It is MADE IN JAPAN not China. You can tell the quality is there in how it feels. So easy to use plus great manual features. We took a 2600 mile trip across the country and the pictures are truly awesome. A great buy for sure. Oh ya,the 3D is very cool. Loving it. A huge Panasonic fan for now on.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am not very technical, I would consider myself an amateur or novice photographer. I recently got the camera and it arrived very quickly and in excellent condition. It is easy to set up. In terms of operating, I am still working my way around it as there are a lot of features. The only negative is there are not a lot of customizations that can be done on the basic menu in and display. I am pleased with the functionality and the ease of taking picture. It is quick and takes very good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Happy coffee

customer_reviews.title: Really liking this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a couple generations old now, but it's definately an upgrade over my previous camera, a Fuji F550. This camera takes nice and clear shots and seems to have a faster shutter speed than the Fuji, which often took blurry pictures. I haven't had a chance yet to test it's ability to take low-light pictures. I like the features and the GPS also works very well, it seems to lock on pretty quickly. With 20x zoom, GPS, built-in picture effects, this is a very good value right now for a travel zoom point & shoot.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: 1-year review
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Push the button and it takes a picture. Instant. No delay. Still does this after owning for a year. Though these cameras were supposed to be replaced by camera phones and high end photography gear as it became cheaper, you still cannot get a better point and shoot for the price. The settings are easy and perfect for an average user like myself. From taking it to work functions, kickball games, or Caribbean sunsets, it does everything I ask it to with minimal clicks of the dial.
customer_reviews.author: eric heis

customer_reviews.title: powerful zoom, somewhat complex
customer_reviews.text: this is a quality camera, has the 20 x zoom, a quality Leica lens. Has a number of optional settings which can get a little complicated for the casual user, takes great pictures in low light. does not seem to be as easily programmed or as versatile as the TS-2 underwater models. I would suggest this camera if you have specific needs for a 20x soon, such as nature or low light photography, but be prepared to spend some time getting to understand its intricacies.
customer_reviews.author: rdmjr

customer_reviews.title: Good deal if you need a compact zoom
customer_reviews.text: I picked this camera up to supplement my SLR when using SLR is not practical. The zoom is pretty good for the size of the package, and picture quality is acceptable. Panorama feature works very well - it even managed to work somewhat during a choppy helicopter flight in a moderate wind - no small task. Not sure what the 3D feature does, haven't used. Pros: Price, touch screen, zoom, lens, PASM mode, picture quality, fast start-up (on/off) Cons: buttons feel a tad flimsy (but not bad overall), f stop is a bit high, which impacts lower light photos, somewhat confusing interface.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around camera for point and shoot.  Great zoom.  Wonderful HD.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid all around camera. It could do a little better in artificial lighted rooms, but other than that, great camera. I also had the previous model to this one, and it was wonderful as well. The only reason I purchase this one is that the old one was dropped in the sand, and I couldn't get the lense to work after that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last year (I know, I'm so far behind on my reviews...) and I still love it. Perhaps it is just in comparison to my old camera or my phone's camera but this takes EXCELLENT shots. The zoom and focus in particular are fantastic. I can get a clear shot of a bird 40-50 feet away through a dirty window and see the worm in his mouth. A fast shutter speed allows me to get the shot the second I press the button and not several seconds after.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth digital camera we've purchased in the last 10 years and it is by far the best of the 4. The pictures are sharp and exposure is quick and simple. Camera feels good in your hand and controls are straight forward. Looking forward to trying it on the motorcycle trips we take. Can't find any faults yet. 3 different people grabbed the camera on Thanksgiving and took excellent pictures without ever using this model before. I would recommend this camera to beginners and not-so-beginners.
customer_reviews.author: John Geiler

customer_reviews.title: Promptly shipped and very well packaged
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smaller Panasonic camera with great zoom and good battery life. The GPS feature does use battery more quickly so I only turn that on when I want to use it and it does work great. I take this camera on tips when I don't want to bring my larger SLR and the picture quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: David B Siefert

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this camera for the price. I have not had much time to really experiment with it yet but love the 20x zoom; a huge upgrade from my old 3x zoom point & shoot. I wish the full manual came with the camera rather than just the "start up" manual. Found the extended manual for all the features on-line but it's a lot of information to read or copy. The CD that came with the camera is NOT Mac compatible which is too bad. I'm looking forward to learning more about this camera's use.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and they are still delivering great images
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace my older Lumix because of the size. I liked my older one, but it was just cumbersome to travel with. This one does the same things and even better. It is much smaller and easier to travel with and I find the pictures are even better than the older large version. I was concerned about lag time. My sister has a smaller version Lumix and she said her lag time was not the greatest. I took a chance and I am not sorry. This one is wonderful. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic has been just terrible to deal with
customer_reviews.text: This camera stopped working for me in less than 6 months. Panasonic has been just terrible to deal with. I had to pay to send them the camera. They promised to have it back in a week. I have been waiting over 3 weeks. When I call I have to go through a computer to get a live person and they tell me "they are too busy". When I ask to speak to a supervisor, they kept me on hold for over 10 minutes, then came back and told me that "no one was available". Don't buy this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Regina Weir

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my expecations.
customer_reviews.text: I took it Chicago to take pictures while I was doing sightseeing and the pictures came out horrible! If I took a picture with the flash it washed everything out. It seemed like the camera had a ton of features but when you are out and about you don't want to have to adjust a ton of settings. The auto setting did not produce good pictures. For the price I was really disappointed with the quality of the pictures that this camera produced.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Oke

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the predecessor to this camera in 2008 and it still works like a champ. This is the update and it takes great photos. It's definitely not a replacement for an SLR/DSLR, but I believe it takes comparable photos. The photo features are fairly useful, but i've found the auto setting is usually best. I took this camera with me hiking and backpacking and the battery lasted very well. I am very satisfied with my purchase and i hope it lasts as long as my other one (which still works perfectly!).
customer_reviews.author: Malia Mason

customer_reviews.title: Terrific camera
customer_reviews.text: No detailed review but this is the 2nd of these cameras I've bot (dropped the last one and fell on it finally killing it). Works very well and takes great pix: close ups, landscapes, portraits...I don't think there is a situation which this small wonder can't handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert photographer. Basically take pictures of friends, nature, and animals. Photos are a bit grainy when magnified. Works for me. Got it at a good price. Camera is very sturdy. Just wanted something that kept a record and did not break when I dropped it. Not so intuitive to move through menu, but I just go on "Automatic". No Ansel Adams here. So, look for a review from someone who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Love my dog

customer_reviews.title: ... this camera and learned that the Ai is the best feature. This camera zooms in on distances that ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this camera and learned that the Ai is the best feature. This camera zooms in on distances that I never knew I could reach with a small camera. It is easy to carry and takes great pictures. I did some hiking and found people caring big cameras, I was thankful for my little Panasonic Lumix that I could put in my pocket when I had to hike up the hills.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Russ

customer_reviews.title: We will see.
customer_reviews.text: Has held up so far. Replaced an Olympus that was about 10 years old. Let's see if Panasonic can measure up. Used it recently for a family vacation and it did well in movie mode for fishing, go-karts, slip-n-slide, etc... Be careful not to bump setting knob. Also, glare on rear LCD screen can be terrible outdoors. Miss not having a mini-viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent under all conditions
customer_reviews.text: We found this camera looking for ones capable of taking good pictures under low light conditions (my wife loves to take pictures in live concerts). It is great!!! Great zoom, excellent picture quality & definition, and the pictures under difficult conditions are excellent!!! And the amount of features it has is amazing!!! (still didn't use many of them). It is very difficult to take wrong pictures with it. The only cons I found are that it was a bit pricey (not much) and some of the features are hard to understand. But once you get use to it, it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Hernan Desio

customer_reviews.title: Great features
customer_reviews.text: Like the ZS19, the ZS 20 delivers. Great travel camera. Lightweight ( compared to the new Canon XS700 it is like a feather), sleek and quick. Great pix, and lots of great features. Price at 170 is perfect. A better value than its newer sibling ( ZS25) from Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Astrotom

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for 2 years and it has never failed me! The quality of the pictures are outstanding and it has many options to choose from in regards to scenes. The only semi-bad thing is the time it takes to take a picture. However, I am comparing this to my zero-shutter lag smartphone. I bought this camera for around $300 and now that it is half the price, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: RecentGrad

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my wife to replace a lost camera that she loved. Panasonic cameras are great cameras and are very easy to use. Point and shoot is what this camera is all about and it takes crisp, clean, clear pictures. I recommend Panasonic Cameras, TVs or any other Panasonic product to anyone at anytime. I own several Panasonic products and all of them perform wonderfully. Please join the Panasonic fan/owner club - you'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning to use this camera but so far I found it great! I have the ability to set it the way I like, or to rely on its many standard settings. I like the spot metering that enables me to pinpoint the area that gets best exposure. The vibration compensation works very well, in particular in video mode. I was able to shoot decent videos in low light. Tu sum-up, this is a great camera to keep on me at all times, in particular when I do not want to carry around my large SLR. It is NOT an SLR replacement for me but complements it quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Marivel

customer_reviews.title: Love this Lumix over newer Lumix Products.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. The 3 Lumix in 5 years. 2 Other quit working. One for zoom lens error and the other for screen issues. But I keep coming back to the same brand. I take thousands of pics a year and I love this one. Tried an newer Lumix but it failed to impress me. This one flashes fine and is very responsive. Gives clear and crisp pictures. Just hope it doesn't crap out after 18 mos. like the other 2.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this camera. Love the 20x optical zoom (I carry a 6" mini tripod) and the GPS tagging, especially when on vacation. Have used it for taking true HD movies and works great. Can be used with an adapter cable (not supplied) for direct HDMI feed to an HDTV (both photos and movies). Learning all the features takes some time but is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: My best camera.
customer_reviews.text: Even ment years after it works fine. New models are sure better but it keep being a very good camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: This Camera is amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic has done it again by makine a stellar product! The camera turns on at the speed of light and is ready to take a picture in what feels like less than a second! the pictures for a point and shoot are very nice and the ease of use of this camera is amazing. Put this camera next to the Nikon 9300 point and shoot series and found that it is faster, takes an equal picture by quality, and is physically a smaller camera so easier to carry in your pocket. Great Product!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Overrated!
customer_reviews.text: Not at the level of similarly priced cameras. I returned this camera as the colors were muted, and the skin textures appeared pasty. Other then the high zoom there's nothing special about it. Also, the lens cover is easily damaged. We got a replacement after 4 week because the cover was getting stuck (it has a multi-layered lens cover that seems fragile).Decided to pay a little extra and get the Canon s100. Much better!
customer_reviews.author: Emil E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Nice small camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice small camera with excellent quality lens. Also has video capability.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Downs

customer_reviews.title: It's just cool...
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Panasonic equipment, but when it comes to cameras I have always stuck with Kodak (as much as to some that may be telling as far as taste in cameras) and enjoyed the quality of Kodak. I think it's just how compact this camera is and how easy it is to connect USB and quickly copy the files. But the MTS file format for video is much preferred (by me) over MPG, so that was a plus as well. I am not displeased at all with the quality of photos in low light, which I expected utter failure. It's just cool... :)
customer_reviews.author: Vance Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a graduation present for my son. He's a good photographer and loves this camera. Because he was doing a lot of traveling/backpacking he didn't want a big camera so this fit the bill. Has a great zoom, and amazing stabilizer. I don't know enough about photography to get technical, but it exceeded my son's expectations. It takes beautiful pics in all kinds of situations.
customer_reviews.author: tjw

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Camera technology has come a long way, and I love these Panasonic cameras. I bought three to use at a wedding, and they were great for that. I took one on my honeymoon, though, and without a view finder, I had to randomly shoot half the trip. The screen is just not bright enough in broad daylight. So this 20x zoom camera could almost replace an SLR and even a video camera, but not in daylight. What a frustration that was.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Second Point & Shoot from LUMIX
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a co-worker which is a newer model than mine. I let her use my model and she loved it. She's not an experienced photographer, just wanting to take "GOOD" pictures. AND SHE DOES! This series of Lumix point and shoot cameras are easy to use and get great results, plus give you the option of doing much more. Video is great for a camera of this class. I'd buy the latest model again!
customer_reviews.author: stevespassion

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: After much research on current point-and-shoot cameras within a modest budget, I landed on this Panasonic. I took this camera to Czech Republic and Sweden and plan to take it to as many other countries as I can afford to visit so long as the camera will live. It takes beautiful shots! It's super smart, has multiple settings that assist in capturing what you see and has fun settings like panorama. With a larger memory card, I was able to take over a thousand photos and nearly every shot was exquisite. Definitely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Panasonic camera purchased by me in the last 7-8 years starting with the FZ3. Size has now become important as also ability to take it out quickly to snap a moment. Hence this purchase. I am knocking off one star because of the battery drain that happens with the GPS feature switched on. Otherwise, this is a very good camera. It doesn't occupy much space and goes anywhere. I have now taken it to multiple locations around the world and every photo has come out well.
customer_reviews.author: 678shopper

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming Performance. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a replacement to my Lumix DMC-ZS5. I am thoroughly underwhelmed by this camera, and feel that the 4 year old ZS5 outshines this in picture quality and features. The "Scene" mode contains less features than before, and the overall pictures quality is not that great. I would recommend avoiding this camera. I really like the Lumix series, but this particular model is a real dud.
customer_reviews.author: J. Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a novelist at best when it comes to cameras. I just wanted a camera that takes great pictures, has a great zoom, and has a lot of scene type options that are easy to use. I have tried 2 more expensive nikons and one cheaper canon before this one over the last couple years. I didn't think they were that great. This camera is the best point and click camera I've ever owned. I couldn't be happier. It is awesome and takes great pictures and video.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: More features than I will ever need, but all the ones I want. The quality is excellent and it is small enough to slide into a pocket [in the neoprene case I bought] but large enough to hang on to. The grip is good. No protector over the extra-large screen - which is easy to see! So a case is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the picture quality and shooting features. I did have a malfunction that required service the first year which is the reason for three stars. The rating would have been higher without the malfunction and lower if not for the free warranty repair.
customer_reviews.author: gv116 in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera one week before a two week trip to Lake Tahoe. I didn't even have time to go through the manual. This camera is very easy to understand and operate. I was able to take some breathtaking pictures because of the quality of this camera. Its a great size to fit in a pocket. The battery lasted longer than I expected if you turn the GPS off. I didnt want to use that function because I knew where I was taking the pictures. Great video quality.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Schenk

customer_reviews.title: A bit complicated interface for simple point-and-shoot camera, but images are of a good quality
customer_reviews.text: It definitely should have simpler interface. It does have a good lens and a potential to be a easy-to-use and user-friendly camera, but Panasonic has better and cheaper cameras than this one. Otherwise the camera works perfectly )once you familiarize yourself with it) and have a lot of useful options, that can make your images of very professional quality (people won't think you made them with point-and-shoot camera). Good buy
customer_reviews.author: T.D.

customer_reviews.title: Love the lumix.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Lumix have a great sensitivity to color. I've compared them side by side to other cameras and the difference is amazing. The panoramic feature is easy and neat to use. Only wish it was a little better in low light without the flash. But it's other features make up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price -- wicked zoom
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous model of this Panasonic Lumix camera and love it (I still use it after owning it for ~7 years). I bought this model for my wife. It's a bit bigger than the earlier version but the size is well worth it. I'm amazed at how good the zoom is on this compact camera. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Tarrant

customer_reviews.title: Poor Zoom design determines life of camera
customer_reviews.text: I do love this camera BUT the Zoom is a poor design. It has a great Leica lens with crisp pictures--many options to take pictures. However, if the Zoom fails to open, no pictures and no camera. Looking online, this appears to be a common problem. This camera lasted 18 months. Isn't there a better Zoom design?? I would like to buy the camera again if there have been improvements to the Zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered had a scratch on the sensor. The return and exchange went smooth. So after that initial hiccup, I love this camera! It takes good video in low light situations. The interface is intuitive and well-organized. Picture quality is excellent! This camera is just as good if not better than the larger prosumer digital cameras. I don't see the need to carry anything around that is bigger than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allways With You Camera
customer_reviews.text: If you want a small camera that you will carry with you all the time, and require more than a smart phone, this is it. The main reason I bought this camera is the Leica lens. This very small, very light, high quality lens, long telephoto zoom was the perfect fit for me. Much better than a good smart phone camera, and much smaller, and in some ways as good as a SLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes awesome photos in the IA mode. My brother took it on a three week vacation in Europe and came home with wonderful photos. He liked it because he could keep it in his pocket. It has a long zoom range. Batteries last a long time. I like to bring it horseback riding. I can hang on to it with the strap and take photos and video while I'm running up a hill. Great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ghiri

customer_reviews.title: I love the ease of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of this camera, especially for video. The dual mics offer great sound even at the rock concerts I attend.... even in front of the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Anne McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera, I have another one
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera, I have another one. It would be perfect if it had a wi fi, and a slightly larger sensor. In some locations such as Alsace, regions are not identified correctly and you think you're in Germany, Panasonic must improve this. The price of the camera is very good, it is cheaper than many other cameras that do not perform even half of it. In my opinion it is better than the newer models, since they have the highest value. For travel, using gps have two batteries
customer_reviews.author: Michalis Karampelas

customer_reviews.title: Great Results, but Buy the Extended Coverage for Breakage
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Panasonic Lumix cameras over the past years. Each eventually had a glitch that caused it to stop working, but the results when they were working, as compared to the price, is wonderful. So far this model is functioning really well! I've enlarged very small areas of photos with great results -- love the 14.1 MP!!! Even used it in a dusty outdoors situation, which was a problem with my other versions of the camera, but there was no problem with the lens mechanism extending and retracting. So far, so good! Note: this time I bought the 3-year coverage for breakage -- I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Evans

customer_reviews.title: My new Lumix from Amazon.com
customer_reviews.text: I have had this new camera for a few short weeks.I have filmed a few short videos and I absolutely love the zoom in and out while filming. The choices with all the gadgets are starting to make sense and the gps is interesting too.I put a strap that goes around my neck on it because the little wrist one that came with the camera just didn't feel reliable enough.When I download the pictures to my laptop, they are real clear and don't need much fixing.I look forward to having lots of fun with this gem!
customer_reviews.author: 1whoknew

customer_reviews.title: Terrific camera at a terrific price.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the last camera I will ever buy. It does everything I want a small form-factor camera to do. Has more features than I will ever use. Supposedly refurbished, there is no question in my mind that the one I was sent was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Burwen

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black) (OLD MODEL)
feature_bullets: 24mm Ultra Wide Angle LEICA DC Lens with 20x Optical Zoom
Full HD video recording with stereo microphone
Supports SD/SDHC/SDXC memory card (Need to be purchased separately)
